hero.description: Enterprise-grade AI API proxy service developed with Go 1.23+, supporting multiple AI providers like OpenAI, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude. Features intelligent key management, load balancing, high concurrency handling, and comprehensive monitoring.

warning.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notice: Please Back Up Your Data!

risks: Service may become unstable or temporarily unavailable
Data may be lost due to service failures
Free service has no SLA guarantee
Instances may be restarted or reassigned

recommendation.title: üîÑ Strong Recommendations:
items: Regularly export and backup your configuration data
Save all important API keys and configuration information
Consider stable paid cloud services for production environments
Use Claw Cloud only for testing and learning purposes

service.title: Claw Cloud Free Deployment
service.description: Lightweight cloud deployment solution using SQLite database and memory storage, with completely free $5 monthly quota

globalDeploy.title: Global Deployment

simpleAuth.title: Simple Authentication

githubLogin.title: Login to Claw Cloud with GitHub

regionSelection.title: Select Deployment Region
regionSelection.description: After login, select an appropriate deployment region in the top-left corner:

launchApp.title: Launch Application Creation
launchApp.description: Click "App Launchpad" in the center, then click "Create App" in the top-right corner to start creating the application

resourceTip.title: Resource Configuration Recommendations
resourceTip.description: Based on the $5 quota calculation, recommended configuration is CPU: 1, Memory: 512M. For personal use with low network traffic, you can reduce configuration to save costs.

completed.title: Deployment Complete
completed.description: The entire creation process is very simple and convenient! After deployment is complete, wait for the public address to take effect, which may take a few minutes.

waitService.title: Wait for Service to Start
waitService.description: Patiently wait for the "Public Address" status to turn green "Available", then you can access your GPT-Load service

getAddress.title: Get Access Address

login.title: Login to Management Interface

appNotStart.title: Application Failed to Start
appNotStart.cause: Possible causes: Image pull failure, configuration errors, or insufficient resources
appNotStart.solution: Solution: Check application logs, confirm image address and configuration are correct

accessFailed.title: Cannot Access Public Address
accessFailed.cause: Possible causes: DNS propagation delay or network issues
accessFailed.solution: Solution: Wait a few minutes and retry, check network connection

authFailed.title: Authentication Failed
authFailed.cause: Possible causes: AUTH_KEY configuration error or not set
authFailed.solution: Solution: Check environment variable configuration, ensure AUTH_KEY is correct

introduction.title: GPT-Load Project Introduction
introduction.subtitle: A high-performance, enterprise-grade AI API transparent proxy service designed specifically for enterprises and developers who need to integrate multiple AI services. Built with Go, featuring intelligent key management, load balancing, and comprehensive monitoring, designed for high-concurrency production environments.

transparentProxy.title: Transparent Proxy
transparentProxy.description: GPT-Load serves as a transparent proxy service, completely preserving the native API formats of various AI service providers without any format conversion or unification. How users request GPT-Load is exactly how GPT-Load requests upstream services, achieving fully transparent proxy functionality.

features: All third-party services compatible with OpenAI format

highPerformance.title: High-Performance Architecture
highPerformance.description: Zero-copy streaming transmission, Go coroutine-based concurrency model, supporting high concurrent connections

keyManagement.title: Intelligent Key Management
keyManagement.description: Group management, dynamic rotation, automatic retry, ensuring high service availability

loadBalancing.title: Load Balancing
loadBalancing.description: Multi-upstream support, weight configuration, health checks, intelligent routing to available nodes

clusterSupport.title: Cluster Support
clusterSupport.description: Master/Slave architecture, stateless design, supporting horizontal scaling

hotReload.title: Hot Reload Configuration
hotReload.description: Three-tier configuration system: environment variables, system settings, group configurations, supporting hot updates

adminPanel.title: Admin Dashboard
adminPanel.description: Vue 3 modern interface, real-time monitoring, log viewing, configuration management

introduction.keywords: GPT-Load architecture, AI proxy technology, transparent proxy principles, microservice architecture, Go language

keyManagement.title: Intelligent Key Management
keyManagement.subtitle: GPT-Load employs intelligent key management mechanisms through polling load balancing, automatic failure detection, and recovery mechanisms to ensure high service availability and stability.

objective.title: Objective
objective.description: Achieve fair load balancing for requests among multiple keys within a group.

atomicCounter.title: Atomic Counter
atomicCounter.description: Ensures polling consistency and fairness under high concurrency

statusFilter.title: Status Filtering
statusFilter.description: Polling scope limited to keys with 'valid' status within the group

trigger.title: Trigger Scenarios
trigger.description: Automatically triggered when request fails (HTTP Status ‚â• 400 or network errors)

step1.title: Mark Failure
step1.description: Increment failure count for the current failed key

step2.title: Get New Key
step2.description: Immediately obtain the next available key within the group through polling

step3.title: Transparent Retry
step3.description: Retry request with new key, transparent to client

step4.title: Retry Limit
step4.description: Configured maximum retry attempts. If all attempts fail, return final error to client

trigger.title: Trigger Condition
trigger.description: When a key's cumulative failure count reaches the blacklist threshold

actions.title: Actions Taken
items: Removed from polling queue, no longer receives new requests

timing.title: Trigger Timing
timing.description: Background scheduled task executed at key validation intervals

step1.title: Health Check
step1.description: Use blacklisted key to request validation endpoint (e.g., models list)

step3.title: Validation Failure
step3.description: Maintain 'invalid' status, wait for next check cycle

loadBalancing.title: Load Balancing
loadBalancing.description: Atomic counter ensures fair polling under high concurrency

autoRecovery.title: Auto Recovery
autoRecovery.description: Scheduled health checks and automatic recovery of failed keys

faultIsolation.title: Fault Isolation
faultIsolation.description: Quickly identify failed keys to ensure service stability

routingStrategy.title: Routing Strategy
routingStrategy.subtitle: Understand GPT-Load's path processing mechanism, master flexible path configuration methods to ensure proper connection between clients and upstream services.

transparentPrinciple.title: Transparent Principle
transparentPrinciple.description: GPT-Load follows the transparent principle, only responsible for path replacement while maintaining maximum flexibility. The core logic is to replace the proxy prefix in client requests with the actual upstream address.
transparentPrinciple.rule: Replacement Rule: GPT-Load Service Address + /proxy/ + Group Name    Replaced with    Upstream Address

configurationMethods.title: Configuration Methods
configurationMethods.description: Using OpenRouter as an example (full path: https://openrouter.ai/api/v1/chat/completions), group name is openrouter, channel type is openai:

method3.title: Configuration Method 3: Complete Version Path
method3.note: Note: Must end with /, avoid client auto-appending v1 path

configurationSuggestions.title: Configuration Suggestions
items: ‚Ä¢ Recommend using configuration method 2 for clear structure
‚Ä¢ First determine the complete upstream API address
‚Ä¢ Choose appropriate path split point based on client characteristics

debuggingTips.title: Debugging Tips
items: ‚Ä¢ Check GPT-Load request logs to confirm upstream address
‚Ä¢ Use test path to verify configuration correctness
‚Ä¢ Pay attention to client path concatenation rules
‚Ä¢ Flexibly adjust configuration to adapt to different scenarios

summary.title: Configuration Summary
summary.description: Understanding path processing logic is key: GPT-Load only handles simple string replacement, flexible configuration methods can adapt to various client and upstream service needs.
summary.principle: Ensure that test address and client request address, after GPT-Load proxy, reach the correct upstream address.

channels.title: Channel Types
channels.subtitle: GPT-Load supports multiple mainstream AI service providers, offering completely transparent proxy access while maintaining native API format and experience.

extensibility.title: Extensibility
extensibility.description: Architecture designed to quickly add new AI service providers through standardized interface adaptation layer for unified access.

parameters.title: Parameter Description
items: group-name: Group name created in the management interface
Supports arbitrary path suffixes with complete transparent forwarding
Maintains all functionality of the original API

authentication.title: Authentication
items: Supports group-level key rotation and load balancing

authentication.title: Authentication Configuration
authentication.description: GPT-Load is fully compatible with OpenAI SDK, only need to change base_url for seamless switching.

migration.step1: Only need to change API base address, all other code remains unchanged

nodejs.title: Node.js SDK

authentication.title: Authentication Configuration
authentication.description: Fully compatible with Google Gemini API, supporting all native features including multi-modal inputs and streaming responses.

original.title: Original Gemini Request

proxy.title: Via GPT-Load Proxy

python.title: Python SDK
python.code:
import google.generativeai as genai

# Configure API Key
genai.configure(
    api_key="your-gemini-api-key",
    client_options={"api_endpoint": "http://localhost:3001/proxy/gemini"}
)

model = genai.GenerativeModel('gemini-pro')
response = model.generate_content("Hello!")

steps: Click "Add Group" and fill in group information

configuration.title: Configuration Points
items: Group name becomes part of the proxy path
Supports multiple API keys per group
Automatic key rotation and load balancing
Supports key health checks and failover
Can set request rate limits and quota management

steps.title: Assess Current State
steps.description: Analyze current AI services and API calling methods

steps.title: Deploy GPT-Load
steps.description: Deploy GPT-Load service following the quick start guide

steps.title: Update Configuration
steps.description: Modify API base addresses in applications to point to GPT-Load

seamless.title: Seamless Migration
seamless.description: GPT-Load's design philosophy is complete transparency. During migration, no business logic modification is needed, just change API endpoint addresses to enjoy unified management and load balancing benefits.

transparent.title: Transparent Proxy
features: No need to modify business code

performance.title: Performance Details
performance.subtitle: GPT-Load adopts a "proxy path first" high-performance design philosophy, where all optimizations ensure ultimate performance and stability of core proxy requests.

proxyPerformance.title: Ultimate Proxy Request Performance
proxyPerformance.description: To achieve minimum latency and maximum concurrency, the core path of proxy requests is designed as "zero I/O operations".

inMemory.title: Full In-Memory Service
inMemory.description: All data required for routing and decision-making, including group configurations and key information, are preloaded into memory during service startup and configuration changes. No database or disk access is needed during proxy requests.

mechanism.title: Real-time Transparent Transmission Mechanism
mechanism.description: GPT-Load adopts real-time transparent transmission mode, directly connecting upstream service data streams to client responses without any intermediate buffering, line-by-line reading, or content parsing.

traditional.label: ‚ùå Traditional Approach
traditional.flow: Line reading ‚Üí Parse processing ‚Üí Buffer output

gptLoad.label: ‚úÖ GPT-Load Approach
gptLoad.flow: Upstream data stream ‚Üí Direct transmission ‚Üí Client

leftColumn.title: Avoid Data Packet Truncation
leftColumn.description: Won't damage original data packet structure due to line-by-line reading

leftColumn.title: Ultimate Compatibility
leftColumn.description: Naturally supports all data formats including SSE, JSON streams, binary, etc.

leftColumn.title: Unlimited Response Capability
leftColumn.description: Theoretically can handle upstream response data of any size

rightColumn.title: Zero-Latency Transmission
rightColumn.description: Data forwarded immediately upon arrival, no buffer waiting time

rightColumn.title: Ultra-Low Memory Usage
rightColumn.description: No data caching, memory usage independent of response size

rightColumn.title: Native Performance Experience
rightColumn.description: Response speed infinitely close to upstream service native performance

asyncLogging.title: Asynchronous Logging
asyncLogging.description: Request logging uses delayed asynchronous write strategy, completely decoupled from request-response lifecycle, ensuring logging operations don't interfere with real-time proxy performance.

httpReuse.title: Efficient HTTP Client Reuse
features: Maintain independent HTTP client instances with reusable underlying connections for each group
When group configurations (like timeouts) change, system dynamically generates new client instances in real-time to ensure immediate configuration effectiveness

atomicOperations.title: Atomic Operations & Lock-Free Design
atomicOperations.description: In high-frequency concurrent operations like key polling counting, use sync/atomic package for lock-free programming, avoiding performance overhead from mutex locks.

mechanism.title: Mechanism
mechanism.description: Operations like adding and validating keys are all executed as asynchronous background tasks.

advantage.title: Advantage
advantage.description: Management operations don't block service, theoretically allowing system to manage millions of keys.

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.description: Supports multi-node Master-Slave architecture for horizontal scaling.

sync.title: Synchronization
sync.redis: Master node configuration changes pushed via Redis Pub/Sub notifications
sync.consistency: Slave nodes listen and pull updates through built-in configuration synchronizer, achieving eventual consistency across cluster configurations

lowResource.title: Ultra-Low Resource Usage
lowResource.description: Thanks to Go language's efficient memory management and the above performance optimizations (like zero-copy, connection pool reuse), GPT-Load runs as a compiled binary with no additional runtime dependencies, achieving ultra-low resource usage.

versatility.title: Wide Applicability
versatility.description: In typical single-machine deployment scenarios, only low CPU and memory are needed to ensure smooth service operation.
scenarios: Capable of handling high-concurrency scenarios for large enterprises
Suitable for resource-limited personal developer environments

configurationPage.title: Configuration
configurationPage.subtitle: GPT-Load adopts a powerful and flexible three-tier configuration system to meet configuration needs in different scenarios

threeLayerArchitecture.title: Three-Tier Configuration System Architecture
threeLayerArchitecture.managerFunction: to manage configuration loading, merging, and hot updates

features.title: Configuration Features
items: ‚Ä¢ Priority Override: Upper layer overrides lower layer

recommendations.title: Configuration Management Recommendations
items: ‚Ä¢ Unified Management: Recommend using the platform's Web interface for centralized management to ensure consistency.
‚Ä¢ Regular Audits: Regularly review configurations, remove unused parameters to keep the system clean.
‚Ä¢ Version Control: For important configuration changes, recommend recording in version control system for tracking and rollback.

warnings.title: Precautions
items: ‚Ä¢ Sensitive Information: Never store passwords, API keys and other sensitive information in project configuration, use environment variables instead.
‚Ä¢ Careful Hot Updates: Hot update feature is powerful but should be used carefully to avoid unexpected behavior in production environment.
‚Ä¢ Performance Impact: Frequent configuration changes may have slight impact on system performance, recommend operating during off-peak hours.

environment.title: Environment Configuration
environment.description: View infrastructure-level configuration through environment variables or .env files.

project.title: Project Configuration
project.description: Explore system-level and group-level dynamic configuration managed through database.

cloudflareAiGateway.title: Cloudflare AI Gateway
cloudflareAiGateway.description: Configure Cloudflare AI Gateway as upstream proxy to optimize AI service performance.

cloudflareAIGateway.title: Cloudflare AI Gateway Upstream Configuration
cloudflareAIGateway.subtitle: This guide will help you configure Cloudflare AI Gateway as GPT-Load's upstream proxy, optimizing AI service request performance and stability through Cloudflare's global network.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.description: Cloudflare AI Gateway only supports certain AI service providers. Before configuration, please confirm that your required AI service channels are in Cloudflare's support list. If your channel is not available in the API platform dropdown list, then that channel is not available.

dashboard.title: Access Cloudflare Dashboard
dashboard.description: Go to Cloudflare official website to register an account and login to the console

selectMenu.title: Select Menu
selectMenu.description: In the left navigation bar, select in order: AI ‚Üí AI Gateway

accessPage.title: Access Management Page
accessPage.description: Enter the AI Gateway management page, where you can see the current gateway list

screenshot.alt: Cloudflare AI Gateway menu navigation screenshot

createButton.title: Click Create Gateway
createButton.description: On the AI Gateway page, click the “Create Gateway” button to start configuring a new gateway

gatewayName.title: Set Gateway Name
gatewayName.note: The name can be set arbitrarily, here using “gpt-load” as an example

defaultSettings.title: Keep Default Settings
defaultSettings.description: Other configuration items can keep their default values

important.title: Important Configuration Items
items: ‚Ä¢ Do not enable caching - CF's cache has bugs in some channels
‚Ä¢ Do not enable gateway authentication - Keep authentication function disabled

screenshot.alt: Cloudflare AI Gateway creation form screenshot

endpoint.title: View API Endpoints

clickAPI.title: Click API Button
clickAPI.description: After creation is complete, click the “API” button in the upper right corner

selectChannel.title: Select Target Channel
selectChannel.description: Find your required AI service provider in the API platform dropdown list and copy the corresponding proxy address

endpoint.note: Each AI service provider has a corresponding proxy address, make sure to select the correct channel

screenshot.alt: Cloudflare AI Gateway API endpoint list screenshot

copyAddress.title: Copy Proxy Address
copyAddress.description: Copy the proxy address obtained from Cloudflare AI Gateway to the upstream address configuration of the corresponding group in GPT-Load

example.title: Example Address:
example.explanation: Where b7fbxxxxxfdba is your account ID, gpt-load is the gateway name, google-ai-studio is the specific AI service provider

screenshot.title: GPT-Load Configuration Example
screenshot.alt: GPT-Load configuring Cloudflare AI Gateway upstream address example screenshot

geminiNotice.title: Gemini Channel Special Notice
geminiNotice.description: When using Gemini channel type with Cloudflare AI Gateway:
items: Recommended: Use Gemini native format calls, works normally
Not recommended: Use Gemini official OpenAI format calls, may cause garbled output issues
geminiNotice.recommendation: This is a known issue with Cloudflare AI Gateway, it is recommended to always use Gemini native format to ensure optimal compatibility.

networkNotice.title: Network Routing Issue Reminder
networkNotice.description1: If your GPT-Load server is located in mainland China or Hong Kong, Cloudflare may route requests to Hong Kong nodes.
networkNotice.description2: Since many AI service providers (such as OpenAI) do not support this region, this may cause
networkNotice.solution: If you encounter this issue, please adjust your server's network environment and retry.

verification.title: Verify Configuration
verification.description: After configuration is complete, send a test request to confirm the proxy is working properly. If you encounter problems, please check the Cloudflare AI Gateway status and GPT-Load configuration for correctness.

managementPage.title: Group Configuration Management
managementPage.subtitle: Complete guide for group creation and configuration, including detailed configuration instructions for basic settings, upstream addresses, advanced settings and other features

groupName.label: Group Name
groupName.description: Unique identifier for the group, used for internal system identification and management. Recommend using meaningful naming

displayName.label: Display Name
displayName.description: Friendly display name for the group, used for frontend interface display to improve readability

channelType.label: Channel Type
channelType.description: Type identifier of upstream service, determines API compatibility and request format

testModel.label: Test Model
testModel.description: Model name used for connection testing to ensure configuration correctness

proxyKey.label: Proxy Key
proxyKey.description: System-generated proxy key for API access authentication, supports generation and copy operations

priority.label: Priority Weight
priority.description: Priority weight of the group, higher values have higher priority, affecting load balancing strategy

multiAddress.title: Multi-Address Load Balancing
multiAddress.description: Supports configuring multiple upstream addresses for load distribution and high availability. Note: Multiple addresses should be different access points of the same service, not different service providers.
multiAddress.sameService: All addresses must be different nodes of the same upstream service
multiAddress.weightRoundRobin: Supports weighted round-robin for intelligent load distribution

features.title: Feature Advantages
features.highAvailability: High availability: Automatic switching during single point failures
features.autoFailover: Automatic failover: Abnormal nodes automatically removed
features.performance: Performance optimization: Nearby node access improves response speed
features.monitoring: Real-time monitoring: Node status and response time monitoring

groupOverride.title: Group Configuration Override
groupOverride.description: Group-level configuration parameters with higher priority than global system configuration. Unconfigured parameters will use system defaults.

reference.title: Reference Documentation
reference.description: For detailed overridable configuration items, please refer to the project configuration page

parameterOverride.title: Parameter Override
parameterOverride.description: Advanced JSON format request parameter override functionality for forcibly overriding specific parameters in user requests. Once configured, it will automatically merge into all requests.

configuration.title: Configuration Management
configuration.testing: Validate in test environment before configuration changes
configuration.backup: Backup current settings before important configuration changes
configuration.validation: Use test functionality to validate configuration effectiveness

security.title: Security Recommendations
security.keyRotation: Regular API key rotation to ensure security
security.monitoring: Monitor abnormal access and error logs

items.name: Slave Node Mode
items.description: Slave node identifier for cluster deployment

items.name: Admin Key
items.description: Admin access authentication key, please change to a strong password

items.name: Database Connection
items.description: Database connection string (DSN) or file path

items.name: Redis Connection
items.description: Redis connection string, use memory storage when empty

items.name: Max Concurrent Requests
items.description: Maximum number of concurrent requests allowed by the system

items.name: Enable CORS
items.description: Whether to enable Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

items.name: Log Level
items.description: Log level: debug, info, warn, error

items.name: Enable File Log
items.description: Whether to enable file log output

proxyConfig.title: Proxy Configuration

priority.title: Priority Description
priority.fallback: Group Config > System Config > Environment Config
priority.envNote: Environment proxy serves as global fallback configuration, only takes effect when neither system config nor group config has proxy settings.

proxyConfig.autoRead: GPT-Load automatically reads proxy settings from environment variables for upstream AI service provider requests.

items.name: HTTP Proxy
items.description: Proxy server address for HTTP requests

items.name: HTTPS Proxy
items.description: Proxy server address for HTTPS requests

items.name: No Proxy
items.description: Hosts or domains that don't need proxy access, comma-separated

summary.title: Environment Configuration Summary
summary.description: Environment configuration is the foundation of the GPT-Load configuration system, primarily responsible for providing infrastructure parameters required for application operation.
features: Basic Service Parameters: Defines core services that application startup and operation depend on, such as server ports, database connections, etc.
Management Features: Configured through .env files or operating system environment variables, loaded at application startup, ensuring configuration stability and consistency.
Usage Advantages: Provides reliable default values for the system while separating sensitive information (such as database passwords, API keys) from the codebase, enhancing security.

storage.title: Storage Method
storage.dynamicModification: Supports dynamic modification via management API
storage.baseline: Provides behavioral baseline for the entire application

appUrl.name: Project URL
appUrl.description: Project base URL for concatenating group endpoints

proxyKeys.name: Global Proxy Keys
proxyKeys.defaultValue: Initial value is AUTH_KEY from environment config
proxyKeys.description: Globally effective proxy authentication keys, separated by commas

logRetention.name: Log Retention Days
logRetention.description: Request log database retention days, 0 for no cleanup

enableRequestBodyLogging.name: Enable Log Details
enableRequestBodyLogging.description: Whether to record complete request body content in request logs, enabling will increase memory and storage usage

requestTimeout.name: Request Timeout
requestTimeout.description: Complete lifecycle timeout for forwarded requests (seconds)

connectTimeout.name: Connect Timeout
connectTimeout.description: Connection establishment timeout with upstream service (seconds)

responseHeaderTimeout.name: Response Header Timeout
responseHeaderTimeout.description: Timeout waiting for upstream response headers (seconds)

maxIdleConns.name: Max Idle Connections
maxIdleConns.description: Maximum total idle connections in connection pool

maxIdleConnsPerHost.name: Max Idle Connections Per Host
maxIdleConnsPerHost.description: Maximum idle connections per upstream host

proxyUrl.name: Proxy Server Address
proxyUrl.description: HTTP/HTTPS proxy for forwarding requests, uses environment config if empty

maxRetries.name: Max Retries
maxRetries.description: Maximum retry attempts for a single request using different keys

blacklistThreshold.name: Blacklist Threshold
blacklistThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failures before a key enters blacklist

keyValidationConcurrency.name: Key Validation Concurrency
keyValidationConcurrency.description: Concurrency level for background scheduled validation of invalid keys

keyValidationTimeout.name: Key Validation Timeout
keyValidationTimeout.description: API request timeout for background scheduled validation of individual keys (seconds)

proxyConfigPriority.title: Proxy Configuration Priority
proxyConfigPriority.description: System proxy configuration has medium priority, overrides environment variable config but can be overridden by group config:
proxyConfigPriority.hierarchy: Group Config > System Config > Environment Config
proxyConfigPriority.fallback: When proxy_url in system configuration is empty, environment variable proxy settings will be used automatically.

highestPriority.title: Highest Priority
highestPriority.override: Can override any parameter in system settings
highestPriority.customize: Customize dedicated behavior for specific groups
highestPriority.proxyPriority: Proxy configuration has highest priority, overrides system and environment settings

summary.title: Project Configuration Summary
summary.description: Project configuration is the core of GPT-Load configuration system, providing powerful dynamic management capabilities covering system-level and group-level configuration.

roleAndLayering.title: Role and Layering
roleAndLayering.description: Divided into "System Settings" and "Group Configuration", the former as global baseline, the latter providing overrides for specific scenarios, implementing hierarchical management.

managementFeatures.title: Management Features
managementFeatures.description: Supports dynamic modification through Web interface and API, configuration changes can be hot-reloaded without service restart, ensuring high system availability.

proxyConfigPriority.title: Proxy Configuration Priority
proxyConfigPriority.description: Group Config > System Config > Environment Config, implementing flexible proxy settings from global to specific groups.

usageAdvantages.title: Usage Advantages
usageAdvantages.description: Provides extremely high flexibility and dynamic adjustment capabilities, allowing fine-grained isolation and optimization for different business scenarios (such as multi-tenancy).

deploymentPage.title: Deployment Guide
deploymentPage.subtitle: GPT-Load provides multiple deployment options to meet different scenario requirements. From lightweight standalone deployment to enterprise-grade cluster deployment, choose the most suitable solution for you.

standalone.title: Standalone Deployment
standalone.subtitle: Lightweight deployment for individuals and small teams

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.description: One-click deployment with Docker Compose, SQLite + memory storage

optional.title: Optional Deployment
optional.description: Configure MySQL/PostgreSQL and Redis for improved performance

fullControl.title: Full Control
fullControl.description: Customize build, configuration and deployment process

development.title: Development Debugging
development.description: Suitable for development environments and feature customization

masterSlave.title: Master-Slave Architecture
masterSlave.description: Distributed deployment with horizontal scaling support

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: If you are new to GPT-Load, we recommend starting with standalone deployment, which provides the best learning curve and quick experience.
